intro: Notylia obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed notylia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are usually pubescent on the underside. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Notylia obtusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
